title: Domain 5.3: Given a scneario, troubleshoot and diagnose problems with storage drives and RAID arrays.
content:
🧠 Troubleshooting Storage Drives and RAID Arrays

💡 LED Status Indicators

  • Green: Drive healthy
  • Amber/Red: Failure or rebuild in progress
  • Flashing: Activity or error (varies by controller)

🔊 Grinding or Clicking Sounds

Grinding: Mechanical failure
Clicking: Read/write head failure ("click of death")

🧠 Back up data immediately if you hear these sounds.

🚫 Bootable Device Not Found

  • Wrong boot order in BIOS/UEFI
  • Disconnected/faulty cable
  • Corrupt OS or failed drive

💾 Data Loss or Corruption

  • Bad sectors
  • SSD write wear
  • Power loss or malware
  • Improper shutdown

💥 RAID Failure

  • RAID 0: No redundancy – any disk fails = total loss
  • RAID 1/5/10: Tolerates some failures
  • Signs: Degraded array, missing volumes, rebuild errors

🛠️ Replace with compatible drives, monitor rebuild closely.

📊 S.M.A.R.T.

Self-Monitoring, Analysis, and Reporting Tech
Checks: sector count, temperature, errors, uptime

🧠 Use tools like CrystalDiskInfo to catch problems early.

🐢 Extended Read/Write Times

  • Failing sectors
  • Low RAM → paging
  • Full drives or mechanical wear

🛠️ Run diagnostics: chkdsk, CrystalDiskMark

📉 IOPS – Input/Output Operations per Second

  • Low IOPS = lag in VMs/games/db apps
  • Caused by: failing drive, misconfigured RAID, controller overload
  • 🧠 RAID 10 > RAID 5 for IOPS

🚫 Missing Drives in OS

  • Not initialized/formatted
  • Disabled in BIOS
  • Driver or cable issues
  • Corrupt partition

🛠️ Use Disk Management (Windows) or diskutil (macOS) to diagnose.
